alert.note: Alert for Horry; Marion (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 03 at 9:01PM EDT until September 08 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina...South Carolina... Northeast Cape Fear River Near Burgaw affecting Pender County. Little Pee Dee River At Galivants Ferry affecting Marion and Horry Counties. Lumber River 1 SE Nichols affecting Horry, Marion and Dillon Counties. Lumber River Near Lumberton affecting Robeson County. Waccamaw River At Conway affecting Horry County. For the Northeast Cape Fear River...including Burgaw...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lumber River...including Nichols, Pembroke, Lumberton Usgs Gage, Maxton, Lumberton, Boardman...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Little Pee Dee River...including Galivants Ferry...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Waccamaw River...including Aiw At old Hwy 544 At Socastee, Conway, Above Conway, Freeland, Longs...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Pee Dee River at Galivants Ferry. * WHEN...Until Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flood waters will continue to rise in the Fork Retch community located near Nichols. Flood waters will begin to affect some homes at Fork Retch. Swampland flooding will increase. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Friday morning and continue falling to 8.7 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm . The next statement will be issued by Monday afternoon.
